section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Audio files stored on mobile devices are played back via the audio system in the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Titles, audio books, and podcasts can be played back.
Depending on the vehicle equipment, the following audio sources can be used:

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Playback of audio files on external storage media via the vehicle’s sound system, e.g. audio files on a USB stick.
Data is transferred via a USB port.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Information on all titles, for instance artist, genre or title, as well as playback lists, are transmitted into the vehicle. The transmission of the information may take some time, depending on the USB device, file size, and number of titles.
During the transmission, the titles can be called up via the file folder.
The information for approx. 16,000 titles can be saved in the vehicle.
Titles with integrated Digital rights management (DRM) cannot be played.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: Compatible storage medium with USB port.
The mobile device must support Mass Storage Class mode.
A USB port with data transfer is used.
Audio files are available in one of the following formats: MP3, M4A, M4B, AAC, FLAC.

section.paragraph: Additional information:

section.title: Selecting the USB device

action-step.paragraph: Connect the USB device at the USB port.
Preferably, use the adapter cable supplied with the USB device.
Select "USB" or name of the USB device.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Playback.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Playback of audio files on external devices via the vehicle’s sound system, such as audio files on audio devices or mobile phones.
Data is transferred via Bluetooth.

item.paragraph: The volume of the sound output may depend on the device. In this case, change the volume setting on the device.

Depending on the supported Bluetooth version, the scope of functions that can be operated via iDrive may be restricted. If necessary, the missing functions can be accessed directly on the device itself.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: The device is connected to the vehicle via Bluetooth®.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Bluetooth connection.

section.title: Activating Bluetooth® audio playback
section.paragraph: The Bluetooth® audio playback can be activated when the mobile device is logged in.
You can activate and deactivate the Bluetooth® audio playback at any time in the device list.
Additional information:
Device list.

section.title: Selecting the Bluetooth device

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired Bluetooth device in the list.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Playback.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Information available for the current track is shown on the Control Display.

For USB and Bluetooth® devices, the selected playlist is displayed. This can be the result of a search or of a previously stored playlist. The display may vary when the music is played back using a smartphone app.
Other functions are displayed next to the playlist on the left. The scope of these functions depends on the selected audio source.

section.title: Selecting a title
section.paragraph: Select the desired title in the playlist.
Starting with the selected title, all titles of the playlist are played.

section.title: Fast forward/fast rewind
section.paragraph: The fast forward/rewind must be supported by the mobile device and the app that is used.

On the instrument panel:

section.title: Reduced display in case of non-operation
General information
section.paragraph: Following a period of time without interaction on the control display or by tapping the cover, the display will be reduced to the title that is currently played back. Tap the control display to end the reduced display.

section.title: Activating/deactivating the automatic reduction of the display

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold cover of the title that is played back.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The possible search criteria depend on the selected audio source.

section.title: Sear for title information
section.paragraph: The search criteria refer to the data stored in the title information.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired search criterion.
For criterion "Search", all titles containing the search string in the title information are displayed. Entering more characters will continue to limit the search results.
If necessary, tap album.
Tap the title at which the playback is going to begin.

section.paragraph: The search for artists and titles can also be selected directly.
To do so, tap "Artists" or "Tracks".
Titles where the selected search criterion is not stored are summarized under "unknown". Titles without title information can only be found via the folder structure.

action-step.paragraph: A list of all available playback lists is displayed.
Tap playlist.
Tap the title at which the playback is going to begin.
Information on playback appears on the Control Display. A playlist is created from the title list resulting from the search.

section.title: Search for further media
section.paragraph: Depending on the USB device and equipment, separate audio book and podcast searches are possible.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired medium.
Tap the title at which the playback is going to begin.
Information on playback appears on the Control Display. A playlist is created from the title list resulting from the search.

section.title: Search in the directory structure
section.paragraph: It is possible to search the USB devices via the directory structure.
The names of folders and titles correspond to folder and file names. The folder and file names can deviate from the names in the title information.

action-step.paragraph: Change into a sub folder, if needed.
Tap the title at which the playback is going to begin.
Information on playback appears on the Control Display. A playlist is created from the title list resulting from the search.
Available albums are graphically presented.
Select the desired album.
All titles of the selected album are displayed.
Tap the title at which the playback is going to begin.
Information on playback appears on the Control Display. The playlist corresponds to the title list of the album.

section.title: Random playback
section.paragraph: After activating random playback via the BMW system, the playlist is reloaded and tracks are shown and played in a random order. When using external devices, the device must support this function. Tap "Shuffle" option on the right next to the playlist.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Online music services are accessed via the Internet.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The available music services depend on the equipment.

item.paragraph: There is a membership with the selected music service.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired music service.
